But sometimes we do need information to provide
services that you request, and this privacy statement explains data collection

**Collection of your Personal Information**

We will ask you when we need information that personally identifies you
(personal information) or allows us to contact you.

Generally, this
information is requested when you are registering before entering a contest,
ordering e-mail newsletters, joining a limited-access premium site, signing up
for an event or training, or when purchasing and/or registering GaDOE
products.

Personal information collected by GaDOE websites often is limited to
e-mail address, language, country or location, but may include other
information when needed to provide a service you requested.

For example: If you choose a service or transaction that requires payment,
such as making a purchase in the Shop area of the website, we will request
personal information necessary for billing and/or shipping, such as: name,
address, telephone number, and credit card number.

When you buy and install a new product, we may ask you to register your
purchase electronically.

We keep this registration information on file with
any information you've already given us on previous visits to our website.

The GaDOE also collects certain information about your computer hardware and
software.

This information may include: your IP address, browser type,
operating system, domain name, access times and referring website addresses.

The GaDOE also collects information about which pages our customers visit
within georgiastandards.org This site visitation data is identified only by a
unique ID number, and it is linked with personal information provided by the
user.

In some limited-entry sections
of GaDOE, with your approval, we will combine site-visitation data with your
personal information in order to provide you with personalized content.

GaDOE abides by the safe harbor framework
as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce regarding the collection, use,
and retention of data from the European Union.

**Protection of Children's Personal Information**

GaDOE is intended for business use and does not knowingly collect any personal
information from children.

One use of cookies is to assist in the collection of the site
visitation statistics described above.

We occasionally hire other companies to provide limited services on our
behalf, including packaging, mailing and delivering purchases, answering
customer questions about products or services, sending postal mail and
processing event registration.

We will only provide those companies the
information they need to deliver the service, and they are prohibited from
using that information for any other purpose.

GaDOE may disclose your personal information if required to do so by law or in
the good-faith belief that such action is necessary to: (a) conform to the
edicts of the law or comply with legal process served on GaDOE or the site;
(b) protect and defend the rights or property of GaDOE and its family of
websites, or (c) act in urgent circumstances to protect the personal safety of
GaDOE employees, users of GaDOE products or services, or members of the
public.

**Control of your Personal Information**

When you register, or otherwise give us personal information, GaDOE will not
share that information with third parties without your permission, other than
for the limited exceptions already listed.
